metadata.title: CVE-2022-1508 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s io_uring modulein the way a user triggers the io_read() function with some specialparameters. This flaw allows a local user to read some memory out ofbounds.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1508` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
